intro: Corydalis hongbashanensis, commonly known as Hongbashan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant features slender, creeping stems and lance-shaped leaves, often growing in shaded, moist environments. It is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
